content.raw:
I was able to reproduce the levels effect for the larger level size. The background appears black in the camera view too.

Performance-wise, it seems that if physics is being computed, e.g. if I happen to teleport the robot somewhere that isn’t on the ground and it falls, then everything subsequently slows down a lot. The next teleport takes many seconds to happen, even if it’s just 50 meters away, which doesn’t involve too much change in levels. The behavior is not unique to this world. I don’t know if it happens if the robot is just moving flat on the ground, but presumably this would happen to quadcopters that are hovering.
content.html:
I was able to reproduce the levels effect for the larger level size. The background appears black in the camera view too.

Performance-wise, it seems that if physics is being computed, e.g. if I happen to teleport the robot somewhere that isn’t on the ground and it falls, then everything subsequently slows down a lot. The next teleport takes many seconds to happen, even if it’s just 50 meters away, which doesn’t involve too much change in levels. The behavior is not unique to this world. I don’t know if it happens if the robot is just moving flat on the ground, but presumably this would happen to quadcopters that are hovering.
